abstract: Bring entities that contain materials created with Reality Composer Pro for use in your visionOS app.

codeExamples.code:
private func createRealityView(_ shaderSampleEntity: Entity) -> some View {
    RealityView { content in
        shaderSampleEntity.position = [0, 0, 0]
        shaderSampleEntity.scale = SIMD3<Float>(
            repeating: 0.75)
        content.add(shaderSampleEntity)
    }
    .glassBackgroundEffect()
    .containerRelativeFrame(
        [.horizontal], count: 3, spacing: 5)
}

overview:
## Overview

Reality Composer Pro gives you the ability to create entities that you can bring over to, and interact with, in your visionOS app. This sample loads the entities created with [https://developer.apple.com/documentation/shadergraph] and places them in a [https://developer.apple.com/documentation/swiftui/scrollview].



## Create the materials in ShaderGraph

In the Project Navigator, open Packages > RealityKitContent, select `Package.realitycomposerpro`, then click Open in Reality Composer Pro.



The `RealityKitContent` package in the sample includes these shaders:

## Create a volumetric view in the app

The sample uses a volumetric view in a [https://developer.apple.com/documentation/swiftui/windowgroup] to load the entities from the `RealityKitContent` package:

## Load the shaders from the content package

The `loadShaders` method loads all the shader entities containing the shader materials from the `ShaderSamplesScene` scene in the `realityKitContentBundle`:

The method saves the entities in a list named `shaderSampleEntities` to be used later to create the [https://developer.apple.com/documentation/realitykit/realityviewcontent].

## Add the shader entities into the RealityView content

The `createRealityView`  method in the sample creates a [https://developer.apple.com/documentation/realitykit/realityview] for an entity and adds it to the [https://developer.apple.com/documentation/realitykit/realityviewcontent] in the `createRealityView` method:

The method positions the `shaderSampleEntity` at the center of the `RealityView` and reduces the scale to fit in the [https://developer.apple.com/documentation/swiftui/scrollview].

## Load the entities into a ScrollView

The sample uses a [https://developer.apple.com/documentation/swiftui/scrollview] to display all the entities in the `shaderSampleEntities` list in a [https://developer.apple.com/documentation/RealityKit/RealityView]. The `ScrollView` shows the name of the shader below the `RealityView`:

The sample loads the shaders in an asynchronous [https://developer.apple.com/documentation/swift/task], and displays the shaders in `ScrollView`.
